newsitem.title: UK: BFI up two as Panamaxes show some life.
newsitem.headline: BFI up two as Panamaxes show some life.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) was up two points to 1,281 and the Baltic Handy Index was down six to 1,079.
Capers have remained largely unchanged but brokers reported improving rates for Panamaxes.

Market rumours suggested 54,000 heavy grain USGulf to Japan was fixed at $21.50 no combination (up 25 cents) and a Panamax has been booked for end May from Plate and Brazil to Lisbon-Hamburg range at a lumpsum equivalent of about between $19.75 and $20.00 basis two to one.

Rumours also suggested 54,000 heavy grain NoPac to Taiwan has been fixed by Joyous World at $11.90 and Seatrans were reported to have fixed Win Trader 73,500 dwt prompt Far East for three to five months at a higher level of $10,250 daily.
At 1200 GMT BIFFEX was up five points in the traded positions and turnover was only 13 lots.
